lines.gurmukhi: logn mY logwcwr bydn mY byd ibcwr log byd bIs iekIs gur igAwn hY
lines.transliteration_english: Logan Mai Logaachaar Baydan Mai Bayd Bichaara , Log Bayd Bees Ikees Gur Giaan Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: A Guru-conscious seeker lives like a worldly being in the society and conducts himself as a knowledgeable person among the scholars. And yet for him, all these are worldly deeds and keeps him unsullied from them. He remains engrossed in the memory of the

lines.gurmukhi: jog mY n jog Bog mY n Kwn pwn jog BogwqIq aunmn aunmwn hY
lines.transliteration_english: Jog Mai N Jog Bhog Mai N Khaan Paana , Jog Bhogaateet Ounaman Ounamaan Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: The yogic practices do not provide a seeker with the true union of the Lord. The worldly pleasures are also devoid of true comfort and peace. Thus a Guru-conscious person keeps himself free from such distractions and enjoys the true bliss by engrossing hi

lines.gurmukhi: diRst drs iDAwn sbd suriq igAwn igAwn iDAwn lK pRym prm inDwn hY
lines.transliteration_english: Drisat Daras Dhiaan Sabad Surati Giaana , Giaan Dhiaan Lakh Praym Param Nidhaan Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Guru-conscious person's vision is always focused on the glimpse of his Guru. His mind is always engrossed in repeated remembrance of Lord's name. In acquiring such divine awareness, he is able to receive the divine treasure of love of the Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: mn bc kRm sRm swDnwDRXwqm kRm gurmuK suK srboiqm inDwn hY ]60]
lines.transliteration_english: Man Bach Kram Sram Saadhanaadhyaatam Krama , Gurmoukh Soukh Sarabotim Nidhaan Hai ?60?

Shabad OS B.translation: Whatever good he does with mind, words and actions, is all spiritual. He enjoys all the happiness in the supreme treasure of Naam Simran. (60)
